title: Calories in Semen
meta_description: Discover calories in semen per average ejaculation, including protein, carbs, sugars, and other nutrients based on typical composition.
assumptions: Average human male ejaculation (~3-5 ml volume); composition based on standard physiological data; no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by individual health, diet, hydration, and frequency; values are approximate. Consult medical sources for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One average ejaculation of semen contains about 15 kcal, mostly from sugars and proteins.

label_note: Values approximate Nutrition Facts style; semen is not a standard food but analyzed for curiosity.

tweaks.label: Higher volume ejaculation (5 ml vs. 3 ml average)

faqs.q: How many calories in one ejaculation of semen?
faqs.a: Approximately 15 kcal for an average 3-5 ml volume.

faqs.q: What nutrients are in semen besides calories?
faqs.a: About 1 g protein, 2.5 g carbs (mostly sugars), and trace fats; also minerals like zinc and sodium.

faqs.q: Does semen have protein for nutrition?
faqs.a: Yes, around 1 g per ejaculation, but it's not a significant dietary source.

faqs.q: How does diet affect calories in semen?
faqs.a: Higher sugar intake can increase fructose content, raising calories slightly (e.g., +3 kcal).
Very low-carb at ~2.5 g per serving, with negligible fiber.
